topics: Principles of UI Design and the User Environment
Designing a Graphical User Interface and Web Design

grading.policies: 20% of the total points will be deducted for assignments received 1-2 days late; assignments received more than 2 days late will receive 0 points. There are no makeups for quizzes but your lowest score will be dropped.

assignments.name: Case Study Challenge
assignments.description: Various case studies throughout the course.

assignments.name: Project 2 Designing the User Interface
assignments.description: Designing the user interface for the second project.

assignments.name: Project 3 Designing an Embedded System
assignments.description: Designing an embedded system for the third project.

policies.late_work: 20% of the total points will be deducted for assignments received 1-2 days late; assignments received more than 2 days late will receive 0 points.
policies.academic_integrity: All Stevens graduate students promise to be fully truthful and avoid dishonesty, fraud, misrepresentation, and deceit of any type in relation to their academic work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.technology_requirements: Basic computer and web-browsing skills, navigating Canvas, live web conferencing using Zoom, current Mac (OS X) or PC (Windows 10+) with high-speed internet connection, webcam, microphone, Microsoft Word.
additional_info.support_resources: For more information about course access or support, contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) by calling 201-216-5500.

_metadata.course_description: This is an introduction to Human Computer Interaction (HCI). It covers basic concepts, principles, and frameworks in HCI; models of interaction; and design guidelines and methodologies.
learning_outcomes: Design a human computer interaction that considers cognition, emotion, and social mechanisms.
Design a human computer interaction that considers how human computer interactions can affect peopleâ€™s attitudes and behaviors.
Collect and interpret stakeholder needs to identify project requirements.
Implement a user-centered approach to design an interface for a given application or activity.
Apply predictive techniques to conduct analytical evaluation and usability testing of a user interface.
Communicate usability testing findings to stakeholders.
